item.text: Star Print ordered on the bill.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6675)

summary.text:
The Global Peacekeeping Operations Initiative Act of 2004 - Authorizes the Secretary of Defense to transfer funds to the Secretary of State for assistance to foreign military or security forces in order to enhance a country's international peacekeeping capability.

States that such assistance: (1) may be used to provide equipment, supplies, training, or funding; and (2) is in addition to any other authority to provide assistance or military assistance to a foreign country.

bill.title: Global Peacekeeping Operations Initiative Act of 2004

item.title: Global Peacekeeping Operations Initiative Act of 2004
A bill to authorize the transfer of funds for foreign countries to participate in international peacekeeping or peace enforcement operations, and for other purposes.
Global Peacekeeping Operations Initiative Act of 2004

latestAction.text: Star Print ordered on the bill.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
